repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
In https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/24469#issuecomment-1651992691, @stasjok observed that in the current implementation, if one LSP client disconnects from a buffer, then inlay_hints and diagnostics will be disabled.

In this PR I've tried to fix that by examining the other LSP clients attached to the current buffer in the `LspDetach` handler. NB the handler is called *before* the client detaches, so we expect the number of attached clients to be 1 if this is the last client in the process of disconnecting.

I also used a similar method in each feature's refresh logic to prevent making calls if no attached clients support the method. This can happen if e.g. you enable inlay hints on a buffer that doesn't have any clients connected that support it.

comment_data.body: There was just another PR merged that adds constants in lsp.protocol.Methods
get_clients supports a `method` filter that can be used instead of this new method
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2229,6 +2230,22 @@ function M._refresh(method, opts)
   end
 end
 
+---@private
+--- Get clients attached to a buffer that support a given method.
+---
+---@param bufnr integer buffer number
+---@param method string LSP method
+function M._get_clients_with_method(bufnr, method)

comment_data.body: Yay for using the new string constants :D
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -11,6 +11,8 @@ local augroup = api.nvim_create_augroup('vim_lsp_diagnostic', {})
 
 local DEFAULT_CLIENT_ID = -1
 
+local PULL_DIAGNOSTIC_METHOD = protocol.Methods.textDocument_diagnostic

comment_data.body: Can this check be added to `util._refresh` instead? Could be an option on `opts` if there is a case(?) where it makes sense to request things not supported by clients...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -408,6 +408,17 @@ local function disable(bufnr)
   clear(bufnr)
 end
 
+--- Refresh diagnostics, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) buffer number
+---@param opts table | nil Additional options to pass to util_refresh
+---@private
+local function _refresh(bufnr, opts)
+  if #vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, method = ms.textDocument_diagnostic }) > 0 then

@@ -131,6 +131,15 @@ local function disable(bufnr)
   end
 end
 
+--- Refresh inlay hints, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) Buffer handle, or 0 for current
+---@private
+local function _refresh(bufnr)
+  if #vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, method = ms.textDocument_inlayHint }) > 0 then

comment_data.body: yeah, good point. I'll move this check into `util._refresh`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -408,6 +408,17 @@ local function disable(bufnr)
   clear(bufnr)
 end
 
+--- Refresh diagnostics, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) buffer number
+---@param opts table | nil Additional options to pass to util_refresh
+---@private
+local function _refresh(bufnr, opts)
+  if #vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, method = ms.textDocument_diagnostic }) > 0 then

comment_data.body:
Hmm, this doesn't always seem to happen.

I think I need to check `vim.lsp.get_clients` and filter out the client that is detaching, and then see if any remain.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -449,7 +460,12 @@ function M._enable(bufnr)
     api.nvim_create_autocmd('LspDetach', {
       buffer = bufnr,
       callback = function()
-        disable(bufnr)
+        -- Only disable if there are no more clients with diagnostics attached
+        -- LspDetach is called *before* the client disconnects, so the number of clients connected
+        -- to this buffer that support diagnostics will be 1 if we're the last client
+        if #vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr, method = ms.textDocument_diagnostic }) == 1 then

comment_regular_data.body: For my own learning: Does this take into account dynamic registration as well?

> For my own learning: Does this take into account dynamic registration as well?

I'm not sure yet. Do you know of a good way to test dynamic registration? What servers currently support it?

> I'm not sure yet. Do you know of a good way to test dynamic registration? What servers currently support it?

I'm honestly not sure either of how to test it either lol. It seems like Solargraph supports dynamic capabilities based on [this discussion in Lazy](https://github.com/LazyVim/LazyVim/discussions/990).

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(lsp): only disable inlay hints / diagnostics if no other clients are connected
